title_en: Writing guidance added to the design systems
description_en: A comprehensive source on how to write good, usable content. This updates and amalgamates guidance from the Canada.ca Content Style Guide and the Writing Guide for the CRA. It also includes new guidance on a variety of topics like considering the needs of your audience and writing for accessibility.

title_en: Improved steps to creating a content inventory
description_en: Based on experience in recent content optimization projects, our content designers made suggestions for improvements to the steps involved in creating a content inventory. This updated version reflects their suggestions and should make the process smoother in the future.

title_en: Added How to Implement section to doormats
description_en: Added a new section to the doormats page where you can try out the different design options - one column, two columns, three columns, as well as variations like stylized steps, dropdowns and adding headings.

title_en: Blog post on UX research with users of screen readers
description_en: Find out what our UX researchers learned during UX testing with users of screen readers. The researchers share their ideas for improving our content and improving how we do research with people with disabilities
linkText_en: UX research with users of screen readers

description_en: Guidance on the purpose of tables, deciding to use a table and designing tables that are accessible and effective.
The links with descriptions that are found in our topic pages and other navigation pages are called doormats. Find out how to write doormats that help users find the best path to complete their task.

title_en: Context-specific features added to GC Web design system
description_en: Context-specific features are in-page components used to promote government activities, initiatives, programs and services. We added a link to this pattern, which is part of the Canada.ca design system.

title_en: Campaign pages added to GC Web design system
description_en: Template for time-limited promotional pages designed to communicate, educate, influence, market, raise awareness and call to action. We added a link to this template, which is part of the Canada.ca design system.

title_en: Corrected code for contact us using interactive questions
description_en: The working example for Contact us using interactive questions had some out of date code. We updated it to include the current version.
Updated the Headings and titles page to clarify the differences in how stacked titles are used in the subway pattern versus in a topic.

title_en: Links added to GC web design system
description_en: Published new guidance on links to help you create links that are effective and accessible.

title_en: New guidance on creating and structuring content
description_en: Published 3 new activities in the Design phase that will help you to build out the content, moving from information architecture to the layout to detailed writing.
linkText_en:
Content location and structure
Wireframing
Detailed content prototypes

title_en: New topic filter in activities catalogue
description_en: We added a topic filter called Content and design in the activities catalogue

title_en: Headings and titles added to GC Web design system
description_en: New guidance on writing good headings and titles, selecting the best page title and organizing content using headings.

title_en: Improved titles and descriptions of design systems based on user research
description_en: In research with users we found that the 3 different design systems were not labelled clearly enough. We updated the titles and descriptions of them to help users find the right design system

title_en: Added GC web design system overview
description_en: Our GC web design system includes components, templates and design basics from the Canada.ca design system, the Web Experience Toolkit and CRA-specific elements.

title_en: Added interim subway pattern guidance to GC Web design system
description_en: The design team is working on detailed guidance for the subway pattern. In the meantime, we’ve added interim guidance and some examples of the CRA variant

title_en: Updated the name of our community
description_en: The name of our community of practice changed to the User-centred design community to better reflect the full scope of the work that we do. We updated the link on the home page to reflect the new name. Have you joined the community yet?

title_en: Added a new objective to the Monitor and refine phase
description_en: When a project ends, our goal is to transfer the optimized content and the knowledge about how to continually improve the content to the responsible program areas. To reflect this, we added an objective called “transition to product maintenance” to the Monitor and refine phase.
